1.text: I Beseech therefore, first of all, supplications to be made, prayers, entreaties, thanks, for all men;

2.text: For kings, and all them being in eminence; that we may lead a gentle and quiet life, in all devotion and gravity.

3.text: For this good and acceptable before our Saviour God;

4.text: Who wills all men to be saved, and to come to the knowledge of the truth.

5.text: For one God, and one mediator of God and men, the man Christ Jesus;

6.text: Having given himself a ransom for all, a testimony in his own time.

7.text: For which I was placed a herald, and the sent, (I speak truth in Christ, I lie not;) a teacher of the nations in faith and truth.

8.text: I will therefore men shall pray in every place, lifting up holy hands, without anger and reasoning.

9.text: And likewise the women in well arranged simplicity, with modesty and discretion, arrange themselves; not in tresses, or gold, or pearls, or expensive clothing;

10.text: But (what become women professing religious worship) with good works.

11.text: Let the woman, in freedom from care, learn in all subjection.

12.text: And I trust not the woman to teach, neither to exercise authority over the man, but to be in freedom from care.

13.text: For Adam was first formed, then Eve.

14.text: And Adam was not deceived, but the woman, having been deceived, was in the transgression.

15.text: And she shall be saved through the bringing forth children, if they remain in faith and love and consecration with discretion.
